answers.answer: The colonoscopy does not cause gastroparesis. The common causes are due to some type of virus, the presence of diabetes, and a category called idiopathic - which means they don't know why the heck it happens.

question: 3 days after my routine colonoscopy, I felt horrible.  Everything I ate made me sick to my stomach.  I never felt anything like that before.  The doctor's office told me to eat lots of yogurt to replenish the bacteria that was stripped during the prep. for the procedure.  These symtoms lasted about two months and finally went away.  Almost a year went by and I had a really bad stomach virus.  After that stomach virus was over, I started to feel the same way I did right after my colonoscopy.  To make a long story short, I ended up seeing a GI doctor.  I had a bunch of tests, one of which was a gastric emptying scan.  The scan confirmed that I had gastroparesis.  My question is, "could the colonoscopy have caused this?"  I know the vagus nerve runs through your body.  Could that have been damaged during the procedure?I have had the gastroparesis since last summer and have lost about 30 lbs.  I feel like I am living in the doctor's office.  Last month I had another endoscopy and had my piloric muscle dilated and injected with botox, which didn't do a thing.  Any other suggestions?Thanks for taking the time to answer my questions.
title: Reason for Gastroparesis
